A green color glowstick in durable plastic tubing. It can be activated by bending the stick to break an internal glass vial, allowing hydrogen peroxide to mix with a phenyl oxalate ester and fluorescent dye. This chemical reaction produces a moderately bright green glow. Glowsticks are reliable light sources and are widely used for low cost emergency signaling and navigation in the Zone, both in dark interiors and expeditions during nighttime. It provides reliable, low-light illumination without the need for batteries or external power sources. Its output however is limited and glowsticks cannot be turned off once activated and are not reusable. Sticks may also activate or break when stored inside a backpack when subjected to impacts.

 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] Lifetime: ~40 minutes
